author: online@orlandosentinel.com (Orlando Sentinel)
title: Oscars: 'Overrated' Meryl Streep saluted
text:
Oscars: 'Overrated' Meryl Streep saluted Meryl Streep Kevin Winter/AFP/Getty Images Twenty-time Oscar nominee Meryl Streep receives a standing ovation Sunday at the Academy Awards. Twenty-time Oscar nominee Meryl Streep receives a standing ovation Sunday at the Academy Awards. (Kevin Winter/AFP/Getty Images) Hal Boedeker ribbed Matt Damon, Denzel Washington and Mel Gibson , but aimed his best lines at Meryl Streep .
Kimmel joked Sunday night that the three-time Oscar winner had phoned it in for more than 50 films. Kimmel turned President Donald Trump ’s criticism of Streep into a standing ovation for the “highly overrated” actress. 
Kimmel also praised Streep’s “nice dress” and asked, “Is that an Ivanka?” 
Of the year’s movies, Kimmel noted, “Black people saved NASA and white people saved jazz.” The line was reference to “Hidden Figures” and “La La Land.” 
Justin Timberlake opened the show by performing “Can’t Stop the Feeling,” a rousing number that put the celebrity audience in a good mood. 
The early awards went to supporting actor Mahershala Ali of “Moonlight,” who received a standing ovation. 
“Suicide Squad” won the makeup prize, and “Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them” was honored for costumes. 
“O.J.: Made in America” was named outstanding documentary feature. 
More to come.
